{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3580458,"name":"Ian2","username":"spacepenguine","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c67d28/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-05T00:09:23.882Z","cooked":"

Hi CD or perhaps particularly the Vivid Hosting folks,

Does the VH-109 radio offer any interfaces to retrieve the ethernet switch port counters such as packet rx/tx, discards, or errors? Bonus points for link state change count if that is available. These are really helpful indicators for cable and connector issues before they progress to driver control (match impacting) issues.

We are familiar with the WiFi link packet counters in status.json. Those are awesome.

Thanks!

I can’t speak to how you would get it, but FMS does see data from the radios such as connection quality, Tx/Rx rate, and time since last packet from the radio.
Im not sure how you would see these outside of FMS/the Field Monitor but it does exist somewhere.

Hmm. Good idea. I like this. We’ll probably cook up a port status report to include packet counts, discards/errors and probably time since link up.

Adding it to our queue!

rackdev:

how you would see these outside of FMS/the Field Monitor

My understanding is that these values get to the field monitor software via the /status page of the radios which respond with a json that has information about the ratio link state including some traffic counters. This information is super useful and it is awesome to have it available so transparently. Here’s an example of what is available from this year’s firmware:
vh109-status.json (1.0 KB)

kiettyyyy:

Hmm. Good idea. I like this. We’ll probably cook up a port status report to include packet counts, discards/errors and probably time since link up.

That’s amazing. Thank you!
